summary: House music is a type of electronic dance music that started in Chicago's underground club scene in the 1980s. It has a fast, repetitive beat and was created by Black gay DJs and producers like Frankie Knuckles and Ron Hardy. House music became popular worldwide and influenced pop stars like Madonna and Whitney Houston. It's still popular today in clubs and on the radio, and it continues to inspire new music and remixes.
title: House music
